Oh my, this is very ugly, especially since it will be very common :/
@dmlloyd any idea?
timeline.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText:
It is hard to do anything as long as we keep using regular expressions and MP config list converter.
One way out could be to let users use globs that we could convert to REs internally. Globs are a bit less expressive than REs, but much easier to use for the 99% of common cases. With globs, the above would be quarkus.native.resources.includes = test-resources/**.txt.
Using a custom list converter with some different escaping mechanism could eliminate two of the four backslashes - not sure it is worth the effort.
replies.author: ppalaga

replies.bodyText: Maybe globs are better, what do you think @gsmet ?
